question: Find the spring constant of the bimetallic bar shown in <image 1> in axial motion.
description:
The image shows a bimetallic bar composed of two layers: one made of steel and the other made of aluminum. The dimensions of the bar are as follows:

- Length (x-direction): 0.5 meters
- Width (y-direction): 2 centimeters
- Thickness (z-direction): 0.5 centimeters

The steel layer is on top, and the aluminum layer is on the bottom. The elastic modulus (E) values for the materials are given:
- Steel: \( E = 207 \times 10^9 \) Pa
- Aluminum: \( E = 83 \times 10^9 \) Pa

The coordinate system is defined with the x-axis pointing to the right and the y-axis pointing downwards.
